imageManipulation
Class Image

java.lang.Object
  imageManipulation.Image
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageWithMessage, ImageWithoutMessage
public abstract class Image
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
John Bannister

This is the master Image class. From this class one of four types will be derived: 1. an object that takes its data from a bitmap file and merges an unencrypted message 2. an object that takes its data from a bitmap file and merges an encrypted message 3. an object that takes its data from a bitmap file that already has an unencrypted message merged and extracts that message 4. an object that takes its data from a bitmap file that already has and encrypted message merged and extracts and decrypts that message. Every object has methods to save either a text file or a processed bitmap file.

Field Summary
protected  int headerEnd
          the location of the last byte of the header portion of the image file
protected  byte[] imageBytes
          the individual bytes of the entire image file in an array for processing
protected  java.io.File imageFile
          the image file on the file system that will be processed
protected  java.lang.String message
          the text that will be processed into the image or extracted
protected  char[] messageChars
          the message in an array of characters for insertion or after extraction

Depending on child object type will call helper methods to setup the object. Used by constructor

isEncrypted

public abstract boolean isEncrypted()
Returns:
returns true if this object's message is encrypted

process

protected abstract void process()
Depending on object type, will either insert or extract the message from the image data. Used by setup().

Parameters:

Returns:

strip

private int strip(int toStrip)
return the least significant 8 bits of an integer with all other bits &ed out. Finding that spurious bits are being inserted when promoting a byte to an int.
